page.title: 08The Ferry
page.content: We interviewed a man called Mr Gosney who was the manager of the chain ferry in Poole Harbour. He has been working on the ferry for about ten years. He has lived in Bournemouth for six years. Mr Gosney has had a couple of accidents on the ferry, the most serious was in October 1984 when the chains snapped and a tug boat pushed it back onto the slipway where it was repaired. Fortunately no one has been injured in an accident yet. Yachts are always hitting the side of the ferry because of the strong currents and winds. Its weight without cars is fifty two tonnes. The chains are about three tonnes. Before the ferry, local fishermen used to row people over to Shellbay. There has probably been a ferry since Henry the Eighth's time. In the winter the winter the water floods the Ferry.
